content.title: Pratyasha Scheme- West Bengal
content.beneficiary: Police Personnel (from Inspectors to Constables) working in the West Bengal Police
content.details: The Govt. of West Bengal has undertaken a housing project scheme named 'PRATYASHA' for Police Personnel to materialize their dreams of owning houses. The West Bengal State Police Housing Corporation will construct various types of flats with the financial assistance of Housing and Urban Development Corporation Ltd (HUDCO).
benefits: Construction of various types of flats for all Police Personnel of West Bengal.
eligibility: Any Police personnel in the ranks of Deputy Superintendent(Non-WBPS)/ Assistant Commissioner, Inspector, Sub-Inspector/ Sergeant, Assistant Sub-Inspector, Constable, and equivalent ranks of West Bengal Police and Kolkata Police can apply.
Only one application per Police personnel is allowed.
In case of a joint application, only a member of the immediate family is eligible to be the second applicant.
Only one flat will be allotted to the eligible applicant.
documents_required: Demand Draft/ Pay Order/ Banker’s Cheque as per category dwelling unit.
Demand Draft/ Pay Order/ Banker’s Cheque for an additional amount only for parking space.
One self-attested photocopy of the PAN Card of the applicant and of joint applicants (if any).
Salary Certificate of the applicant(s) issued by the DDO.
Two sets of passport-size photographs with signatures on the back side.
One canceled cheque of the applicant.
Copy of the first page of the Bank A/C Pass Book of the applicant showing address, A/C No., Branch Code No., etc.

faqs.question: What is ‘PRATYASHA’?
faqs.answer: The Govt. of West Bengal has undertaken a housing project named 'PRATYASHA' for Police Personnel to materialize their dreams of owning houses.

faqs.question: Which agency will construct various types of flats for Police Personnel?
faqs.answer: West Bengal Police Housing & Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited.

faqs.question: Who is the beneficiary under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Any Police personnel in the ranks of Deputy Superintendent (Non-WBPS)/Assistant Commissioner, Inspector, Sub-Inspector/ Sergeant, Assistant Sub-Inspector, Constable, and equivalent ranks of West Bengal Police and Kolkata Police can apply.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, various types of flats for all Police Personnel will be constructed.

faqs.question: How many types of flats will be constructed under this scheme?
faqs.answer: There are three types of flats will be constructed under this scheme- Category ‘A’, Category ‘B’ & Category ‘C’.

faqs.question: How many flats will be allotted to an eligible applicant?
faqs.answer: Only one flat will be allotted to the eligible applicant.

faqs.question: How will the beneficiary be selected for the flats?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will be selected through a lottery on a random selection basis.

faqs.question: Where can I find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application can be downloaded from the websites of Kolkata Police.

faqs.question: Where shall I submit my application form?
faqs.answer: Application Form duly filled in and completed in all respect may be submitted at the office of West Bengal Police Housing & Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited.
